subclassFeature.name: Incantatrix
entries: You draw your power from an innate connection to the all-pervasive, invisible streams of magic which flow throughout the planes. Your connection is a gift bestowed seemingly at random throughout the generations, and feels like a sixth sense, a silent tugging to places of great power. By tapping into these magical reservoirs, you have learned to channel a surplus of arcane energy into your Metamagic, and can use this to extents normal spellcasters could never hope to achieve.

subclassFeature.name: Metamagic Savant
entries: When you choose this origin at 1st level, you gain 1 Metamagic option of your choice and 1 sorcery point.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Metamagic
entries: Starting at 1st level, your connection to the land's ley lines grants you a boon to your magic. All known Metamagic costs 1 fewer sorcery points, to a minimum of 1.

subclassFeature.name: Free Metamagic
entries: At 6th level, you learn to store the land's magic in your own body, and may use any Metamagic you know without expending sorcery points. After using this ability, you cannot do so again until completing a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Connecting the Streams
entries: At 14th level, you learn to connect others to the stream of magic. As a reaction you may apply any Metamagic you know to any spell cast within 30 feet. This Metamagic costs double the normal number of sorcery points.

subclassFeature.name: Metamagic Mastery
entries: By 18th level, you have perfected the use of Metamagic. You gain the ability to use any Metamagic that is not currently on your list of known Metamagics. Using one of these costs double the normal number of sorcery points, and is not reduced by Improved Metamagic.

subclassFeature.name: School of Universalism
entries: Though most wizards specialize in a single school of magic, the rare and exceptionally gifted can advance their studies without losing focus on any arcane school. These wizards are known as Universalists, and can wield the forces of any arcane school with equal measure.

entries.name: Arcane Savant
entries: Beginning when you select this tradition at 2nd level, the amount of gold required to copy a spell into your spellbook is halved.

entries.name: Arcane Memorization
entries: At 2nd level, choose 1 spell that you know to memorize. This spell is always prepared and does not count against your total number of spells known. You can select an additional spell to memorize at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Condensation
entries: By 6th level, you can expend two spell slots of the same level to cast a spell of 1 level higher.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane recitation
entries: At 10th level, the time required to cast a spell as a ritual is reduced to 1 minute, unless casting time of the spell is longer.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Concentration
entries: By 14th level, your focus is legendary. Whenever you would lose your concentration on a spell, you can instead choose to maintain your focus by expending a spell slot of a level greater level or equal to the spell you are concentrating on.

subclassFeature.name: Versatilist

entries.prerequisite: Archery fighting style or the Two-Weapon fighting style

entries: The two classic expressions of a ranger are the close combatant, flurrying through combat with a weapon clutched in each hand, and the pinpoint sniper, dealing death with each loosed arrow. Yet a small number of rangers refuse to specialize into one of these camps, and instead perfect the art of balancing both styles in a fierce amalgamation of lethal fury.

entries.name: Additional Fighting Style
entries: Beginning when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain the Archery fighting style or the Two-Weapon fighting style.

entries.name: Versatile Combatant
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your mix of fighting styles provides the following benefits:

items: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can make an attack with a ranged weapon as the second attack.
You do not have disadvantage when you make a ranged attack within 5 feet of a hostile creature.
On your turn, you can draw and stow a number of weapons up to your Dexterity modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Sure-Footed
entries: By 7th level, when you are prone, standing up uses only 5 feet of your movement. Additionally, your base walking speed increases by 5 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Adaptable Assault
entries: At 11th level, when you use your {@action Attack} action to make one light melee weapon attack and one ranged attack, you can make one additional attack with a light or ranged weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Flexible Defense
entries: Your flexible fighting style makes you challenging to predict. By 15th level if a creature attacks you and does not have advantage on the attack roll, you can use your reaction to increase your armor class for the attack by your Dexterity modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Gladiator
entries: The violent showmen of bloodsport, and the avatars of slaughter, archetypal gladiators revel in battle. More than that, they transform killing into performance art. The crucible of fighting pits and coliseums produce gladiators in droves, but only the most merciless and popular survive to make their reputation and escape as free men. As such, free gladiators often have as much celebrity as they do a genuine love of brutality.

entries.name: Sidebar: Gimmick
entries: Most successful gladiators perform in the coliseum with some kind of theme to boost crowd appeal. For example, you might wear furs to look like a werewolf, or you may fight with a showy but impractical exotic weapon. Whatever gimmick you choose, it's a vitally important part of your gladiatorial persona and should be reflected in your Personality Traits.

entries.name: Appeal to Audience
entries: At 3rd level, if there is a non-combative audience watching you fight, once per turn, you can gain a bonus to a melee attack roll equal to the number of people in the audience, up to a maximum of your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Brazen Defense
entries: At 3rd level, even if you fight with little armor, your panache in combat makes you challenging to hit. While unarmored, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Bloody renown
entries: By 7th level, your reputation as a deadly combatant precedes you. You have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks against humanoid creatures that have heard of your fighting prowess.

subclassFeature.name: Robilar's Gambit
entries: At 10th level as a bonus action, you can enter a special fighting stance. Until the beginning of your next turn, each time a creature within your reach attacks you, it has advantage on its attack roll, but provokes an Opportunity Attack from you when it hits you, which you can make without expending a reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Crowd Favorite
entries: By 15th level, when you hit with a melee attack, you can add your Charisma modifier to your damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Execution
entries: At 18th level, when you hit with a melee attack, you can deal maximum damage in addition to the damage roll. This attack ignores damage resistance. After using this ability, you must complete a short or long rest before using it again.
